The '''White Company''' was the guard of the [[Prince of Ithilien|Princes of Ithilien]] during the [[Fourth Age]].<ref>[[Robert Foster]], [[The Complete Guide to Middle-earth]], entry "White Company"</ref>

== History ==
The company was created by King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] in {{TA|3019}} to settle the complex case of [[Beregond]], as he had abandoned his post and spilled blood, yet saved [[Faramir]] from an early [[The Pyre of Denethor|death]] upon doing so. Elessar exiled Beregond from [[Minas Tirith]], but appointed him to be the first '''Captain of the Guard''' of Prince Faramir<ref>{{PM|Shadow}}, p. 411</ref> to dwell within the hills of [[Emyn Arnen]] in sight of Minas Tirith.<ref>{{RK|VI5}}, pp. 1269-70</ref>

During the early [[Fourth Age]], [[Borlas]] and two old servants retired to [[Pen-arduin]] from the '''Prince's guard'''.<ref>{{PM|Shadow}}, note 14</ref>

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
'''2019: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online|The Lord of the Rings Online: Minas Morgul]]'':'''

:After King Elessar charges Steward [[Faramir]] with cleansing the evil of [[Minas Morgul]], Faramir leads the White Company into the [[Morgul Vale]], where they and the [[Rangers of Ithilien]] establish several camps outside the Dead City.
